Package eu.opends.tools

Class SpeedDifferenceComputer

java.lang.Object
eu.opends.tools.SpeedDifferenceComputer
public class SpeedDifferenceComputer
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a computer for differences between the car's speed and the maximum allowed speed. The mean deviation (arithmetic average) and standard deviation can be computed.
Author:
Rafael Math

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    SpeedDifferenceComputer()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    float getAverageDifference()
    Computes the mean deviation (arithmetic average) of all recorded speed differences.
    float getStandardDeviation()
    Computes the standard deviation of all recorded speed differences.
    boolean isReportAvailable()
    Checks whether a speed difference report for the log file is available.
    void reset()
    Resets the speed difference computer for the next speed limit segment.
    void setSpeedLimit​(int speedLimit)
    Report, when the speed limit has changed.
    void update​(float carSpeed)
    On every simulation step, the difference between the car's speed and the allowed speed will be added to a list.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • SpeedDifferenceComputer

      public SpeedDifferenceComputer()

  • Method Details

    • setSpeedLimit

      public void setSpeedLimit​(int speedLimit)
      Report, when the speed limit has changed. If the speed limit is changed again to unlimited (=0), a report to the log file can be performed.
      Parameters:
      speedLimit - Speed value to compute difference with car's speed.

    • update

      public void update​(float carSpeed)
      On every simulation step, the difference between the car's speed and the allowed speed will be added to a list.
      Parameters:
      carSpeed - Speed value of the car.

    • isReportAvailable

      public boolean isReportAvailable()
      Checks whether a speed difference report for the log file is available.
      Returns:
      True, if a speed difference report is available.

    • getAverageDifference

      public float getAverageDifference()
      Computes the mean deviation (arithmetic average) of all recorded speed differences.
      Returns:
      Mean deviation (arithmetic average) of all speed difference values.

    • getStandardDeviation

      public float getStandardDeviation()
      Computes the standard deviation of all recorded speed differences.
      Returns:
      Standard deviation of all speed difference values.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the speed difference computer for the next speed limit segment.
